name: Load information
rtc_off
tooltip: Turn OFF the heatpump when the roomtemperature is xx C above the setpoint. When current operating mode includes DHW, it will change OM to DHW only.  Note: if you do NOT want this part of the function, set the OFF temperature very high.

name: rtc_on
tooltip: Turn ON the heatpump when the roomtemperature is xx C below or above the setpoint. Or the OperatingMode will be restored like it was before it was changed to include HEAT again. Note1: Make sure the on temperature is LOWER then off temperature (this will cause oscillating behaviour.) Note2. If you do not want this functionality, just set the on temperature very low.

name: Function schedule
Solar functions
label: Solar functions
tooltip: Turn on/off the Solar energy function.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
What can this function do for you?

The aim of this function is to increase efficiency (and save cost) by utilize solar energy as much as possible. When there is solar energy in abundance, you can tell the heatpump to use that energy to heat up your DHW water tank. To determine if there is enough solar energy, you need any form of power measurement. This can be a P1 power meter, or a meter directly behind your panels.

The Instruction is split into two parts.

1st part in Node-Red flow page (http://IP:1880/#flow)
Follow the instructions in the white comments in the tab: WP Solar

2nd part is the instruction of this dashboard and is written below.

Solar function

This enables / disables this function.

DHW temperature setpoint low/high

This is the target temperature for the water in DHW tank. The high setpoint will be used when solar power reached the threshold. By default, setpoint low is used at the beginning of each day. Note: Setpoint low is the same setpoint as set in HOME tab (DHW SP)

Power detection method

There are two options are available. Option 1: kW production now and option 2: kWh production today.
kW production now Live energy export of the house expressed in Watt. See image 1.
kWh production today Todays cumulative energy export of the house, expressed in kWh. See image 2. This value will only increase. Energy import (at a later time) will not be subtracted from the value.

Solar Production threshold (XX)

The threshold above which the new DHW temperature setpoint high should be sent to the heatpump as a new target.

Fallback to SP low below 0 W?

By default, once setpoint high is used, it will not switch back to setpoint low on the same day. If you do want to fall back to SP low when power production drops below zero W, enable 'fallback' toggle. This will only apply for the power detection method kW.

Override power state

When the heatpump is turned off, do you want this function to turn the heatpump on again? Enable switch to allow 'turn on' action
